proverb: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná
translation: No one gives way (or defers) to someone who used to own a horse
wisdom: Don't live in the past: where we have been is not as crucial as where we are going; have a strategic-mindset and focus
scenarios: Chidi boasted about his past wealth at a networking event, but attendees ignored him. He shifted focus to current skills and gained respect. Living forward earned him new opportunities.;Sade clung to her old fame as a singer, but audiences moved on. She trained in digital media, finding success by focusing on the present.

proverb: Ipá ńmú ẹṣin lọ sódò, ipá ò fún un lómi mu
translation: You can force a horse to the river but you can't force it to drink water
wisdom: You can provide opportunities, but you can't force anyone to take or make the best of them; you can't force anyone to do what he or she is determined not to do.
scenarios: Emeka offered his cousin a job, but she refused to work diligently. Her inaction stalled her career, despite his support. He realized he couldn’t force her ambition.;Aisha enrolled her brother in a free course, but he skipped classes. His failure showed her you can’t make someone seize opportunities.

proverb: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò, ọ̀nì fàá, tí a bá fi ẹsẹ̀ méjèjì s'ódò kí la mọ̀ pó fẹ́ ṣẹ'lẹ̀
translation: We dipped a leg into the river and the crocodile snapped at it; who knows what would have happened had we dipped the two
wisdom: To be forewarned is to be forearmed.
scenarios: Ngozi ignored a small debt warning, and it grew into a legal issue. She paid heavily but avoided bigger loans after. Early caution saved her from worse trouble.;Femi dismissed a safety alert at his shop, nearly causing a fire. He installed alarms afterward, thankful for the warning.

proverb: A kì í mọ̀ọ́ rìn mọ̀ọ́ yan kí orí má mì l'ọ́rùn
translation: One cannot be so good at walking and marching that the head won't shake
wisdom: Tolerance is it; no one is perfect.
scenarios: Kemi criticized her team’s minor errors but ignored her own. Her team resented her, and projects suffered. She embraced tolerance, improving collaboration.;Tolu snapped at his friend’s typos but made similar mistakes. His friend distanced himself, teaching Tolu to be patient with imperfections.

proverb: Ìkòkò ńse iṣu ẹnìkan ò gbọ́, ṣùgbọ́n iṣú dé inú odó tán ariwo ó ta
translation: While the pot was cooking the yam, no one heard a thing, but no sooner had the yams got into the mortar than noise broke out
wisdom: Avoid obtrusive grandstanding: empty vessels make the most noise.
scenarios: Yemi shouted his startup’s launch on social media, drawing unnecessary scrutiny. His quieter rival thrived unnoticed. He learned to work silently for success.;Sade’s loud party plans annoyed neighbors, who complained. She hosted a discreet event next time, earning their approval.

proverb: Ọ̀rẹ́ ẹ mí só, èmi náà yóò só; olúwarẹ̀ yóò kàn ṣu sára ni
translation: My friend farts, I must fart; you will simply end up defecating on yourself._
wisdom: Stay in your lane and embrace your uniqueness; be secure in who you are: don't compare yourself with anyone.
scenarios: Chidi copied his friend’s business model to fit in, losing his edge. His venture failed, but he rebuilt with his unique vision. Staying authentic brought success.;Amaka mimicked her colleague’s style, feeling insecure. She embraced her own approach, earning respect for originality.

proverb: Ẹni tí kò dúpẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀fà, bẹ́ igi dí ọ̀nà egbèje
translation: Whoever is not grateful for small favours, blocks the path to bigger ones
wisdom: Attitude of gratitude is it; kindness calls for gratitude; and gratitude beckons on more kindness.
scenarios: Funmi ignored a small loan from her sister, who later refused a bigger favor. She thanked her belatedly, rebuilding trust. Gratitude opened doors to more help.;Jide took his neighbor’s free rides for granted, and they stopped. He showed appreciation, and the rides resumed, valuing small kindness.

proverb: Àìní ìforítì àparò ló sọ ọ́ di aláṣọ pípọ́n
translation: Patridge's lack of perseverance is what gave it its dirty garb
wisdom: Perseverance is it; Lack of perseverance may deprive you of what ought to rightfully be yours.
scenarios: Tolu failed exams repeatedly but kept studying, unlike peers who quit. He passed and got a job, proving persistence pays. His effort secured his future.;Sade struggled with fitness goals but didn’t give up. She ran a 5K, showing perseverance’s rewards.

proverb: Ẹni tó jẹ ọba tán tó tún ńwo òkè fẹ̀ fẹ̀ fẹ̀, ṣé ó fẹ́ di Olódùmarè ni?
translation: Does the person who kept looking upwards in dire expectation after just being crowned a king want to become God?
wisdom: Contentment is it; lack of contentment can be stressful.
scenarios: Chidi kept buying gadgets to feel fulfilled, stressing his budget. Debt taught him to value what he had. Contentment eased his financial strain.;Kemi envied others’ promotions, chasing titles. She focused on her role’s impact, finding peace in her progress.

proverb: Bí ará ilé ẹni bá ńjẹ kòkòrò búburú, ó yẹ ká sọ fún un, nítorí hùrù hẹrẹ rẹ̀ kò ní jẹ́ ká sùn lóru
translation: If your companion is eating a harmful insect, caution him (or her); else, the effect on him won't let you sleep at night
wisdom: Be proactive; to be forewarned is to be forearmed.
scenarios: Yemi saw his friend binge-drinking and stayed silent, but it caused chaos. He later warned him, preventing worse outcomes. Proactive care saved their bond.;Aisha noticed her cousin’s risky investments but didn’t speak. After losses, she advised caution, averting further ruin.

proverb: Tí ọmọdé bá rí ẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tó ńgun ẹṣin lọ níwájú, ó yẹ kó wo ẹgbẹ́ bàbá a rẹ̀ tó ńfi ẹsẹ̀ rìn bọ̀ lẹ́hìn
translation: A youngster who's anxious at his (or her) peers riding horses ahead, will do well to look back to see his father's mates trudging behind
wisdom: Contentment is it.
scenarios: Tolu envied classmates with fancy cars but saw older relatives struggling. He focused on his studies, content with his pace. Patience kept him grounded.;Sade felt behind her peers’ careers but noticed her elders’ resilience. She worked steadily, trusting her journey.

proverb: A ní kí ohun tó wu'ni wá, ohun tó dára ló yọjú; bó bá dára bí kò wu'ni ńkọ́?
translation: One beckons on what one desires, but the beautiful pops up; what if it's beautiful but it's not desired?
wisdom: Our choice remains our choice: it's inviolable; beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
scenarios: Funmi rejected a suitor for looks, chasing her ideal. He proved kind, and she regretted her choice. She valued character over appearance next time.;Jide ignored a modest car for a flashy one, which broke down. He learned beauty lies in reliability, respecting his preferences.

proverb: A kì í gba àkàtà lọ́wọ́ akítì; a kì í gba ilé baba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ ọmọ
translation: No one can stop monkeys from squatting; no one should deprive a child of his patrimony
wisdom: Be fair and just; don't deprive people of what is rightly theirs.
scenarios: Kemi tried evicting a tenant unjustly, but laws protected them. She lost in court, learning fairness matters. Justice preserved her reputation.;Tolu denied his sibling inheritance, sparking a feud. He shared fairly later, restoring family peace.

proverb: Agara kì í dá oníṣẹ́ Ọlọ́run
translation: God's messenger never grows weary
wisdom: God cannot be overwhelmed with man's needs; try Him.
scenarios: Emeka prayed for strength during a crisis, and solutions emerged. His faith sustained him through layoffs. Trust in God kept him hopeful.;Aisha leaned on prayer when her shop struggled. Unexpected customers arrived, reinforcing her belief in divine help.

proverb: A kì í fi ọjọ́ kan, bọ́ ọmọ tó rù
translation: A lean child cannot be fattened in just one day
wisdom: Good things take time: be patient, but be dogged;  don’t force issues before their time, but keep feeding the issues without relenting.
scenarios: Chidi rushed his son’s training, expecting quick results. Slow progress frustrated him until steady effort paid off. Patience built his son’s skills.;Sade pushed her garden to bloom fast, but it wilted. Gradual care yielded flowers, teaching her time’s value.

proverb: Ẹni tó sùn là ńjí, a kì í jí apirọrọ; táa bá jí apirọrọ kò ní dáhùn
translation: The person sleeping is the person one wakes, not the person pretending to be asleep; the person pretending won't respond, if one wakes him or her
wisdom: Unsolicited advice or assistance is seldom appreciated.
scenarios: Yemi advised a colleague unasked, who ignored him. The colleague failed, proving unsolicited help is wasted. Yemi focused on willing listeners.;Kemi pushed tips on her friend, who brushed them off. She helped only when asked, saving effort.

proverb: Ẹlẹ́rù ló ńgbé ẹrù ẹ̀ kí a tó báa fọwọ́ kún un
translation: The owner has to first pick up his (or her) luggage before others will extend hands of support
wisdom: Take responsibility and ownership, before seeking help; don't expect support from others, if you're unwilling to do all you can.
scenarios: Tolu waited for others to fund his startup, delaying progress. He pitched in first, and investors joined. Ownership sparked support.;Sade expected free help for her event but got none. She worked hard, and volunteers followed, valuing her initiative.

proverb: Bí a bá pẹ́ lórí imí, eṣinkéṣin a máa bá’ni níbẹ̀
translation: Whoever takes unduly long in open defecation, may well play host to strange flies
wisdom: Undue tardiness often results in unexpected outcomes; make hay while the sun shines.
scenarios: Chidi lingered on a late project, missing deadlines. Distractions cost him a contract, teaching him urgency. Timeliness saved future deals.;Aisha delayed her shop’s repairs, facing leaks. Quick fixes later prevented losses, showing promptness pays.

proverb: Bí onírèsé bá kọ̀ tí ò fín'gbá mọ́, èyí tó ti fín ò leè parun
translation: Even if the calabash carver stops carving calabashes, those already carved will remain
wisdom: Even if we refrain from kind acts, those rendered still live on; keep up the kindness: they are never wasted or lost.
scenarios: Funmi stopped mentoring kids, but her past students thrived. Their success reminded her kindness endures. She resumed, knowing acts live on.;Jide’s old donations helped a shelter survive. Its gratitude inspired him to give more, seeing lasting impact.

proverb: Ẹni tó ṣe ohun tó dun'ni lóòní le ṣe ohun tí yóò dùn mọ́ni l'ọ́la
translation: A person who hurts one today may well be a blessing to one tomorrow
wisdom: Write-off no one; quit being vindictive: be forward-looking; there are no permanent enemies, only permanent interests.
scenarios: Kemi held a grudge against a rude client, missing a deal. She forgave him, and he referred others. Letting go opened opportunities.;Tolu cut off a friend who lied, but later needed his skills. Reconciliation brought mutual gain, showing no permanent foes.

proverb: Agbẹ́-igi-lére kan kò lè gbẹ́ inú u rẹ̀
translation: No sculptor can carve the internals of the statue he or she is carving
wisdom: There is a limit to what anyone can do: be reasonable in your expectations; most people are doing the very best they can, regardless of how it seems.
scenarios: Emeka tried fixing a complex machine alone, failing. He hired experts, succeeding with limits in mind. Reasonable expectations saved time.;Aisha pushed her team beyond their skills, causing errors. She set realistic goals, boosting output.

proverb: Gbogbo ẹkún kọ́ làpẹrẹ ìbànújẹ́; gbogbo ẹ̀rín sì kọ́ ló túmọ̀ sí ìdùnnú
translation: Not all tears signify sadness; not all laughters imply happiness
wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; look beyond the obvious.
scenarios: Yemi mistook his friend’s tears for sadness, but they were joyful. He asked, learning not to assume. Looking deeper built trust.;Sade thought her boss’s laughter meant approval, but it hid critique. She clarified, avoiding mistakes.

proverb: Bí orí kan bá sunwọ̀n á ran'gba
translation: If one head is blessed, it will positively impact two hundred others
wisdom: Success can be contagious; a well-targeted intervention can positively affect several others.
scenarios: Chidi’s promotion lifted his team’s morale and pay. His success spread benefits, inspiring others. Targeted wins helped many.;Kemi’s scholarship funded her village’s school, aiding dozens. Her achievement uplifted her community.

proverb: A ní kí ẹ jẹ ẹ́, ẹ léegun lásán ni; a ní kí ẹ gbé e sọnù ẹ lẹ́ran díẹ́ wà ńbẹ̀
translation: Asked to eat it, you claimed it is a mere bone; yet when asked to discard it, you insisted it still has some meat
wisdom: Greed spurs indecision and discontentment; the greedy is seldom contented.
scenarios: Tolu hoarded project funds, delaying decisions. His team quit, and he lost more. Contentment would have saved his venture.;Aisha clung to old stock, missing sales. Letting go cleared space for profit, curing her greed.

proverb: Bí inú ṣe kéré tó, ó fi ààyè gba ọmọ
translation: As small as the belly is, it has room for the baby (the foetus)
wisdom: We always make room for what is important to us.
scenarios: Funmi prioritized family, finding time despite a busy job. Her kids thrived, proving space for what matters. Duty shaped her schedule.;Sade squeezed in charity work, balancing her shop. Her efforts grew, showing room for priorities.

proverb: Yinni yinni kí ẹni ṣè'mí ì
translation: Praise a kind person and he or she will be spurred to do more
wisdom: Praise and appreciation inspire and bring increase.
scenarios: Chidi praised his team’s small wins, boosting their output. Their loyalty grew, delivering bigger projects. Appreciation sparked progress.;Aisha thanked her staff, inspiring extra effort. Their dedication increased sales, proving praise works.

proverb: Ààtàn tí kò bá gba ẹ̀gbin, kò ní kún bọ̀rọ̀
translation: A refuse dump that won't tolerate filth won't be filled up easily
wisdom: Be tolerant; intolerance can impose limitations.
scenarios: Kemi rejected messy clients, limiting her business. She tolerated chaos, doubling her sales. Openness removed barriers.;Tolu shunned risky partners, stalling growth. He worked with them, gaining contracts through flexibility.

proverb: Báa gún iyán nínú ewé, táa se ọbẹ̀ nínú èpo ẹpà, ẹni máa yó, á yó
translation: Even if we pound yam in a leaf and prepare the soup in a groundnut pod, those who would be full, would be
wisdom: No impossibility; keep hope alive.
scenarios: Emeka cooked with scarce ingredients, feeding his family. Creativity solved shortages, keeping hope alive. Resourcefulness beat despair.;Aisha sold crafts with cheap materials, thriving in a slump. Her ingenuity sustained her business.

proverb: Àlejò bí òkété là ńfi èkùrọ́ lọ̀
translation: A guest like bush rat is the one offered palm kernel
wisdom: Appearance matters: how you appear dictates how you'll be received.
scenarios: Chidi dressed poorly for a meeting, losing a deal. He polished his look, winning clients. Appearance shaped outcomes.;Sade arrived unkempt at an interview, failing it. She dressed sharply next time, landing a job.

proverb: Ẹni ọ̀rẹ́ dà, kó má ṣe bí'nú; ẹni abínibí ńda'ni
translation: Those betrayed by friends shouldn't be offended; even siblings betray one another
wisdom: Tolerance is it; forgive and forget; don't hold on to hurts.
scenarios: Funmi held a friend’s betrayal against her, straining ties. She forgave, rebuilding trust. Letting go healed their bond.;Tolu stayed mad at his cousin’s deceit, losing family support. Forgiveness restored harmony.

proverb: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dáyé ológbò ni í jìyà, bó bá dàgbà, á tó ọdẹ ẹ́ ṣe
translation: Only as a kitten is the cat in deprivation, once fully grown it can do its own hunting
wisdom: The best is yet to come; keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever.
scenarios: Chidi struggled as a young intern but grew skilled. His expertise later won contracts, showing better days come. Persistence paid off.;Aisha faced losses early in her shop but learned fast. Her profits soared, proving tough times pass.

proverb: A kì í mọ orúkọ Ọlọ́run, kí ìyà ó jẹ'ni
translation: One cannot really know God's name (or know God for sure) and suffer
wisdom: God is dependable; He is a present help, for those who trust in Him.
scenarios: Emeka trusted God during a flood, finding shelter. His faith brought aid, easing hardship. Divine reliance sustained him.;Kemi prayed through illness, recovering unexpectedly. Her trust in God brought peace.

proverb: Kíkéré l'abẹ́rẹ́ kéré, kì í ṣe mímì fún adìyẹ
translation: A needle may be tiny, but it’s not an object to be swallowed by the hen
wisdom: Don't judge a book by its cover: never judge by appearance; underestimate no one.
scenarios: Tolu ignored a small rival, who outbid him. The loss taught him to respect all competitors. Underestimating none saved future deals.;Sade dismissed a tiny leak, causing damage. She fixed small issues after, avoiding bigger losses.

proverb: Bí a ò kú, ìṣe ò tán
translation: As long as there is life, there is no end to what one can still achieve
wisdom: With life, there is hope; no impossibility; never ever give up.
scenarios: Chidi kept working despite setbacks, launching a shop. His resilience built wealth, proving life offers chances. Hope fueled his success.;Aisha survived a fire and rebuilt her stall. Her persistence thrived, showing no end to possibility.

proverb: A kì í dàgbà jù fún ohun tí a kò bá mọ̀
translation: One is never too old to learn what one does not know
wisdom: There is no end to learning: be oen to it; age is no barrier to learning.
scenarios: Emeka learned coding at 50, landing a job. Age didn’t stop him, proving learning never ends. Openness brought opportunity.;Kemi took finance classes at 60, managing her shop better. Lifelong learning boosted her profits.

proverb: Báa gún ata nínú odó, báa lọ̀ ọ́ lórí ọlọ, iwa ata ò ní fi ata sílẹ̀
translation: Even if we pound it in a mortar or grind it on the grinding stone, pepper will remain inseparable from its character
wisdom: Old habits die hard; we can hardly pretend to be who we are not, for long.
scenarios: Tolu smoked despite warnings, harming his health. Quitting was hard, showing habits cling. Old behaviors resisted change.;Sade kept yelling at staff, losing them. Controlling her temper took effort, proving character sticks.

proverb: Ìwà kì í fi oníwà sílẹ̀
translation: We are inseparable from our character
wisdom: No one can pretend to be who he or she is not for very long; be patient, ultimately, the real character will show through.
scenarios: Chidi gossiped despite his kind nature, hurting ties. His true self showed through, regaining trust. Character couldn’t hide long.;Aisha cheated once but helped others later. Her generosity shone, proving her real nature.

proverb: Ò yẹ kí ìdí gbé àtàrí wò, kó mọ iṣẹ tí eṣinṣin ńṣe
translation: The buttocks should trade places with the head, to appreciate what flies do (to it)
wisdom: Be hesitant to criticise: you can't be too sure of what others are going through, if you've never been in their shoes.
scenarios: Emeka judged a struggling worker harshly, unaware of their pain. He listened, offering support instead. Empathy stopped quick critique.;Kemi mocked a slow vendor, then faced delays herself. She learned to understand others’ challenges.

proverb: Bí ìgbà bá ńgbá'ni ká máa rọ́'jú; bó pẹ́ bó yà ìgbà ńbọ̀ wá gba'ni
translation: If a season afflicts, we ought to persevere; the good times will soon come
wisdom: Persevere and keep hope alive; tough times won't last forever; change is inevitable.
scenarios: Tolu lost a job but persevered, finding a better one. Tough times passed, proving change comes. Hope kept him steady.;Aisha endured a slow market but sold out later. Her patience paid off, showing seasons shift.

proverb: Ẹni sọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ yó ṣìsọ; àsọjù ló ńmú ìyá ọba pe ara rẹ̀ ní ìyá ọ̀bọ
translation: Whoever talks excessively will misspeak; excessive talk made the king's mother (inadvertently) referred to herself as the mother of monkeys
wisdom: Moderation is crucial; exercise self-control, always.
scenarios: Chidi rambled at a pitch, confusing clients. He lost the deal but spoke concisely next time. Moderation won contracts.;Sade overshared at work, sparking rumors. She spoke less, regaining respect through restraint.

proverb: Ọ̀nà tí èèyàn tọ̀ tó ṣubú, bí èèyàn bá ní sùúrù, èyàn lè tọ̀ọ́ là
translation: A path that one treads and fails, with patience, one may well tread it to success
wisdom: No closed case and no impossibility: if you won't give up, you will win; be open-minded, be patient and be persistent.
scenarios: Tolu failed a test but studied harder, passing later. Patience turned failure into success. Persistence opened doors.;Kemi’s first sale flopped, but steady tweaks worked. Her calm effort built a steady business.

proverb: Ẹní bá rọra pa èèrà, á rí ìfun inú u rẹ̀
translation: Whoever would calmly and patiently dismember an ant would see its intestines
wisdom: Be calm, be even keeled, and be patient: virtually nothing is impossible, with these.
scenarios: Chidi rushed a deal, missing key terms. Slow review later saved a contract. Patience solved complexity.;Aisha dissected a problem calmly, finding a fix. Her steady approach resolved issues.

proverb: Yàrá kékeré gba ogún ọ̀rẹ́, tí ìfẹ bá wà láàárín wọn
translation: A little room is sizable enough for twenty friends, if there is love in their midst
wisdom: Love is it: little is much if love is in it; with love, a cottage may well pass for a castle.
scenarios: Funmi hosted friends in a tiny flat, bonding deeply. Love made it enough, proving affection trumps space. Care built connection.;Tolu shared a small office with partners, thriving. Their unity showed love expands limits.

proverb: Àìsanra tó ajá ológìnní kì í ṣe ti àìjẹun ká'nú; bí ìran rẹ̀ ṣe mọ ni
translation: The smaller frame of cats' relative to dogs isn't for want of food; that's cats' genetic makeup
wisdom: Appearance can be deceptive; often, there is more than is immediately obvious.
scenarios: Chidi assumed his thin frame meant weakness, but he outworked others. His strength was hidden, proving looks deceive. Effort trumped appearance.;Aisha’s plain shop drew loyal clients, hiding profits. Its success showed more than meets the eye.

proverb: Ọ̀pọ̀ ló fẹ́ láàpa láì lápá, bí èèyàn ò sì lápá, kò leè láàpa
translation: Many want to make a mark without effort, yet without effort, no marks can be made
wisdom: Nothing ventured, nothing gained; diligence pays.
scenarios: Tolu skipped training, expecting quick wins. He lost deals, learning effort is key. Diligence brought success.;Kemi avoided marketing, hoping for sales. Her stall lagged until she worked hard, proving marks need effort.

proverb: Bí a kò bá dẹ́kun ìgbìyànjú, bó pẹ́ bó yá akitiyan wa á dópin lọ́jọ́ kan
translation: If we won't give up, our hustling will one day end
wisdom: Finish whatever you start: never give up, never quit; if we won't quit, we will win.
scenarios: Chidi kept pitching despite rejections, landing a deal. His hustle ended with success, proving persistence wins. Quitting wasn’t an option.;Aisha faced loan denials but saved up, opening a shop. Her refusal to stop paid off.

proverb: Ẹni tó ńsáré tó ńwo ẹ̀hìn, ó di dandan, kó fi ẹsẹ̀ kọ
translation: Whoever keeps looking back while running, will certainly stumble
wisdom: Ignore distractions; stay focused and keep moving.
scenarios: Tolu checked social media mid-race, tripping. He focused next time, winning. Distractions cost him, but focus prevailed.;Kemi looked back at rivals’ gains, slowing her work. Staying forward-driven boosted her output.
